result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:46 PM Defendant Jonathon Bernard Brooks in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video. Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Michael Doran of the Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. Deputy Clerk of Court Amy Sheridan sworn testimony taken by video for conviction on case 16CF470. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Activity:  Initial appearance

04:00 PM Defendant Jonathon Bernard Brooks in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video. Emmeline Lee and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $5,500 Cash bond with conditions:  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of any weapons or firearms. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
